Node.definition: = referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire
= state in which the outward appearance of humans, animals, or objects is pleasing to the eye
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

= referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found
= person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire
= action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another
= person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire

Node.gloss: to go down|to come down|to climb down|to step down|to descend
Node.definition: = action by which human, animals, or deities move (voluntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place
= a fenced portion of land, ► used for growing flowers, plants, and vegetables, but also as burial place; ≈ associated with beauty and fragrance

= tree of 2 3 meters tall, with small, wrinkled, three part leaves, white flowers, and pea sized red berries that have a fragrant yellow seed inside; the bark of younger branches is gray, turning brown with age; it grows in desert or semi desert climates; ◄ Opobalsamum; ► the tree is wanted for its resin, which appears by itself in green droplets from the stems and branches, but collectors also make cuts in the branches to speed the process; the droplets turn from green to brown, clump together, and fall to the ground, where they are collected; the resin is used in holy anointing oil, as medicine, and as an ingredient of perfume
= action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people
= a fenced portion of land, ► used for growing flowers, plants, and vegetables, but also as burial place; ≈ associated with beauty and fragrance
= causative action by which humans or animals bring together and take in objects from scattered places or sources

= a flowering plant with an erect stem and long narrow leaves; it can grow to 1.5 m high; it has a bulbous root and cone shaped flowers, usually with 5 6 petals, which protrude straight out or slightly downward from the stem; ◄ Lilium candidum; ► associated with unsurpassed beauty
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire
= person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire
= action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

= a flowering plant with an erect stem and long narrow leaves; it can grow to 1.5 m high; it has a bulbous root and cone shaped flowers, usually with 5 6 petals, which protrude straight out or slightly downward from the stem; ◄ Lilium candidum; ► associated with unsurpassed beauty
= female person who has a special and intimate relationship with another person
= state in which the outward appearance of humans, animals, or objects is pleasing to the eye
= a referent to a female participant addressed in a discourse
= town; ◄ territory of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= state of inspiring a mixture of both wonder and fear, because of a combination of fearsomeness and beauty
= group of soldiers wielding banners (דֶּגֶל) ≈ considered a beautiful, though frightening, sight
literally: to turn (one's) eyes; hence: = action by which humans look away from something they have been looking at before

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= the fine thread like strands growing from the skin of humans and certain animals
= a large group of domesticated mammals that moves and stays together, either in an enclosure or in a open area ◄ usually sheep or goats, but can also include camels or cattle

= a fairly small, female domestic animal, usually black and with floppy ears, hooves and relatively short hair, and usually found in one single flock (צֹאן) with sheep; ► raised for its milk, meat, and skin; a clean animal and therefore to be eaten

Node.gloss: to descend|to surge down|to stream down
Node.definition: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = action by which animals move down from an elevated place by skipping down from one place to another, ≈ which produces an elegant picture
= area on east side of the Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) ◄ supposedly named after Gilead, son of Makir (מָכִיר) tribe of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)
= a large group of domesticated mammals that moves and stays together, either in an enclosure or in a open area ◄ usually sheep or goats, but can also include camels or cattle
= female sheep; ► associated with submissiveness

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
= causative action by which humans wash an animal with water, ► in order to remove any dirt
= causative action by which someone gives birth to twins
= state in which humans or animals have lost one or more of their offspring

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= thin, broad piece of food cut from a larger portion

= a small tree reaching a height of 3 5 m, with narrow, dark green leaves and thorny branches; its has a red flower and produces red round fruits with a hard skin and tightly packed pockets of seeds inside; ◄ Punica granatum; ► the seeds can be made into wine; the flower shaped end of the fruit made it an attractive decoration on stone and in the temple; ≈ associated with love, beauty, and sex
= relation denoting that someone performs a certain event via the path of something else
= gauze like covering; ► worn over the face, usually by women; ≈ associated with beauty
= state in which a countable entity is sixty in number
= female, foreign ruler of a nation or area
= state in which a countable entity is eighty in number
= a woman who lives with a man but has lower status than his wife or wives

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
literally: there is no counting (of it); hence: = state in which objects cannot be counted or measured because of their abundance
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine

= a bird with a blue gray color with a pinkish sheen to the neck feathers and a black tip on its tail; lives in large colonies and eats mainly seeds; courts, mates, and has nests several times a year; nests on rock ledges; ◄ |iColumba livia|i*; ► used as food and for sacrifices; ≈ regarded as swift, docile, and innocent, but also as silly and senseless; associated with affection, fertility and sexuality because of its mating habits; the moaning sound this bird sometimes makes is associated with pain and suffering
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine
= state in which humans possess a beauty that is not marred by anything
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
literally: daughters of a town, region, nation; hence: = women that are inhabitants of a place, town, region, or nation, ◄ as if they were the female offspring of that place
= to communicate to someone else that you consider him/her or someone else fortunate and blessed by God; ≈ accompanied by an attitude of respect
= female, foreign ruler of a nation or area
= a woman who lives with a man but has lower status than his wife or wives
= action by which humans or divine beings express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to (other) humans or deities about who they are and what they do

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= state in which the outward appearance of humans, animals, or objects is pleasing to the eye
= state in which humans possess a beauty that is not marred by anything
literally: the hot one; hence: = the heavenly body from which the earth derives its light and warmth; ≈ associated with light and, by extension, with happiness
= state of inspiring a mixture of both wonder and fear, because of a combination of fearsomeness and beauty
= group of soldiers wielding banners (דֶּגֶל) ≈ considered a beautiful, though frightening, sight
= a fenced portion of land, ► used for growing flowers, plants, and vegetables, but also as burial place; ≈ associated with beauty and fragrance
= walnut tree; has a broad crown and fresh green oval leaves which offer welcome shade and an agreeable fragrance; ► produces edible nuts, covered by a thick rind which yields a brown dye

Node.gloss: to go down|to come down|to climb down|to step down|to descend
Node.definition: = action by which human, animals, or deities move (voluntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= part of a plant or tree that is typically surrounded by brightly colored petals and will eventually develop into a fruit
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

= a creeping plant that develops a woody stem when it matures; it grows along the ground until it finds a tree or other object to climb, using tendrils (שָׂרִיג) ◄ vitis vinifera; ► it bears clusters (אֶשְׁכֹּל) of grapes (עֲנָב) that are sweet and juicy and can be made into wine (יַיִן) ≈ a symbol of blessing, prosperity, and happiness
= process by which plants to produce flowers

= a small tree reaching a height of 3 5 m, with narrow, dark green leaves and thorny branches; its has a red flower and produces red round fruits with a hard skin and tightly packed pockets of seeds inside; ◄ Punica granatum; ► the seeds can be made into wine; the flower shaped end of the fruit made it an attractive decoration on stone and in the temple; ≈ associated with love, beauty, and sex
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

Node.gloss: to place|to put|to lay|to set|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place
= open vehicle with two or four wheels, pulled by one or more horses; ◄ made or wood and iron; ► used in war or for travelling

m.definition: = member of the nobility; ≈ associated with authority; expected to be generous, reliable, and just
